3-16-22

Major feature update

  • Added interactive MA plot
  • Added interactive heatmap
  • Added metadata viewer and ability to add custom metadata
  • Added interface to view genes in UpSet plot intersections
  • Other minor additions
    • Added gene plot y-axis controls & autoscale option
    • Added option to view non-DE genes in DE results table

1-13-22

  • Added option to set category name lengths for functional enrichment plots.
  • Added option to turn off legend for gene plots.
  • Fixed bug where ‘gene’ & ‘symbol’ columns were not being found in DE result table for functional enrichment plots.

12-16-21

  • Added copy/paste functionality to Gene scratchpad
  • Added Admin panel to edit data areas and user list
    • Lab data areas and sync server buttons now available to all BSPC members

11-26-21

  • Decoupled gene scratchpad from comparison selection. Now the scratchpad is not reset on changing comparison.
    • As a consequence, the top 5 genes (based on padj) is not selected for a comparison by default.
    • Instead, users now have a Add top genes button which will add top 3 up- and down-regulated genes (based on log2FoldChange)to the scratchpad.
    • This mechanism will allow users to add top genes from multiple comparisons if so desired. To restart the gene collection, a Reset button has also been added.
  • Added controls to edit faceting variables. The new controls are now available in the More options panel of the gene plot.
    • Current faceting variables are shown in a dropdown variable menu, and the levels of the selected variable is then displayed in the levels box.
    • To change the order of levels, delete a value and reinsert in a different location. Deleted levels are removed from the plot. Levels can be reset using the Reset button.
    • The gene order cannot be edited using these controls and so gene will not appear in the variable dropdown even if selected. However, the gene order shown in the plot can be edited directly by changing the order in the Gene scratchpad box.
  • Added metadata-based sample selection for PCA plots (admin only).
    • This is to let the user select/deselect groups of samples based on metadata.

11-19-21

  • Revamped gene plot and upset plot controls with bucket list interface and buttons to Select all and Select none.
  • Added option to use library-size normalized data for gene plots. The previous VST normalization is still available as an option.
  • Added option to make gene plots or PCA plots using all samples or sample subsets. Granular sample selection in PCA plots also added (admin only).

10-27-2021

  • Added summary table of contrasts

10-20-2021

  • Added internal controls to investigate PCA plots
  • Added mechanism to use different access yaml files based on host
    • Also included checks for existence of access yaml. This should avoid server disconnect errors on RStudio Connect if file system in not mounted.

09-08-2021

  • Significantly updated Functional enrichment section:
    • Added new visualizations (radar, alluvial, dendrogram)
    • Added new ‘clustered’ enrichment (Distill enrichment, Fuzzy clustering)
    • Replaced/updated existing plots (summary_overview, enrichment_map)
      • summary_overview replaces the dotplot from earlier versions.
      • enrichment_map is an interactive version of the earlier emapplot.
      • Two additional versions of enrichment_map (emap_distill, emap_fuzzy) depicts grouped/clustered views of the enrichment, corresponding to Distill enrichment and Fuzzy clustering, above.
    • Added ability to compare functional enrichment results between gene sets in the Compare results tab. This can be used to pinpoint similarities and differences at the level of functional enrichment analysis.
      • There are three ways to visualize this: summary_overview, radar and horizon plots.
  • Reorganized app interface
    • General plots, e.g. PCA plot, MA plot, gene plot, grouped under DE analysis section.
    • Cleaner sidebar - additional options now under collapsible panel
  • Revamped and more user-friendly Help pages
